alert.note: Alert for Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 3:38AM CDT until March 26 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Douglas, Ozark and Taney. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little North Fork River at County Road 916, North Fork River at County Road 278, Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, South Spring Creek at County Road 408, Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road, Bryant Creek at Highway 95 and Spring Creek at County Road 142. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Forsyth, Merriam Woods, Rockaway Beach, Taneyville, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Walnut Shade, Lake Taneycomo, Bryant Creek State Park and Shepherd of the Hills State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
